entries.title: Fan extravaganza in Qatar as Argentina win 2022 World Cup
entries.description: Argentina fans ecstatic after victory in dramatic final, while France supporters rue loss in penalty shootout.

entries.title: Twitter bans ‘free promotion’ of other social media platforms
entries.description: Social media giant says it will remove content linking to accounts on Facebook, Instagram, Mastodon and others.

entries.title: Low turnout a message from Tunisian people to Saied: ‘Step aside’
entries.description: Opposition parties say the only way forward for Tunisia is to get out of President Kais Saied’s system of one-man rule.

entries.title: Tears of relief and joy as Messi lifts World Cup for Argentina
entries.description: Waves of euphoria sweep through Argentina fans after dramatic victory over France makes them champions for a third time.

entries.title: What does Japan’s military expansion mean for the region?
entries.description: Tokyo announces its biggest military build-up since World War II.

entries.title: Messi says he will not retire from Argentinian national team
entries.description: After lifting the World Cup, the 35-year-old star says he will continue playing in an Argentina shirt for a while yet.

entries.title: France fans hail Mbappe’s dazzling World Cup final performance
entries.description: Mbappe secured the golden boot with his hat-trick in the final and came close to winning a second World Cup.

entries.title: US says it ‘looks forward’ to working with new Peru president
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken called on political actors in Peru to ease tensions and pursue 'reconciliation'.

entries.title: Photos: Messi and Argentina lift World Cup after win over France
entries.description: After an incredible match that went into penalty kicks, the Argentinians claimed football's biggest prize.

entries.title: Kylian Mbappe wins World Cup Golden Boot award, beating Messi
entries.description: Mbappe scored eight goals, including three against Argentina on Sunday in an exhilarating final at Lusail Stadium.

entries.title: Qatar 2022 timeline: How Argentina came to lift the World Cup
entries.description: Argentina's third World Cup win caps Lionel Messi's unbelievable career.

entries.title: Messi’s Argentina beat France on penalties to win World Cup
entries.description: Lionel Messi's Argentina overcome France in rollercoaster showpiece event concluded by Gonzalo Montiel's spot-kick.

entries.title: Teenager charged after refugee boat capsizes in English Channel
entries.description: The 19-year-old was charged with abetting illegal immigration after four people died while trying to cross the Channel.

entries.title: Qatar holds spectacular World Cup closing ceremony ahead of final
entries.description: Light, art, poetry, music and fireworks - Qatar puts on a classic World Cup closing ceremony.

entries.title: World Cup finals boost National Day celebrations in Qatar
entries.description: This December 18 marks Qatar's National Day and the final match between Argentina and France in the FIFA World Cup.

entries.title: World Cup finals boost National Day celebrations in Qatar
entries.description: This December 18 marks Qatar's National Day and the final match between Argentina and France in the FIFA World Cup.

entries.title: The trouble with Edward Snowden
entries.description: The whistleblower has readily spoken up on many things, except on Putin's war.

entries.title: Türkiye emerges as a leader of the zero-waste movement
entries.description: The country's leadership has inspired progress on achieving zero waste at home and abroad.

entries.title: At least 12 killed in accident in Afghanistan’s Salang Tunnel
entries.description: The government said 37 people were injured after a fuel tanker caught fire, and the death toll was expected to rise.

entries.title: ‘Maradona is guiding us’: Argentina fans ahead of World Cup final
entries.description: Argentina fans are seeking inspiration from the late Diego Maradona as they hope their team can repeat his 1986 magic.

entries.title: Qatar says ‘inaccurate’ information in Belgian corruption probe
entries.description: Authorities have charged four people, including a European Parliament vice president, over alleged influence campaign.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: The Scorecard
entries.description: “I’ve been blown away by the atmosphere.”

entries.title: ‘Preventive conservation’ at Venetian palace
entries.description: Art restorers intervene on precious artworks and elaborate ornamentation at the Doge's Palace in Venice.

entries.title: Liberians protest living costs as Weah returns from 48-day trip
entries.description: Analysts warn of more protests ahead of the 2023 elections despite President Weah's popularity in parts of Liberia.

entries.title: ‘Republic of fear’: A return to Yemen after 11 years
entries.description: In April, a nationwide truce provided a much-awaited opening for a return home.

entries.title: EU reaches agreement on pivotal carbon market deal
entries.description: Negotiators were at odds over how quickly to end free CO2 permits the EU gives industries.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 298
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 298th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: ‘We’re going to win’: Argentina waits in hope for World Cup title
entries.description: A nation battered by crises is coming together to cheer for Argentina as they face France in Sunday's World Cup final.

entries.title: Mbappe vs Messi: Winner takes all at World Cup 2022
entries.description: France can win the World Cup even if Mbappe is kept quiet. Argentina have no hope of winning if Messi doesn’t turn up.

entries.title: Kenya: Music, activism and ending police violence
entries.description: Disillusioned by electoral politics, an activist and a musician mobilise against police killings and government neglect.

entries.title: At least eight police killed in blast near Iraq’s Kirkuk
entries.description: Those killed near the north-central city were police officers, security sources told Reuters.

entries.title: Palestinian-French rights lawyer Hammouri deported by Israel
entries.description: Hammouri had been held in Israeli administrative detention based on 'secret evidence' without charges since March.

entries.title: From president on down, France revels before World Cup final
entries.description: 'I’m backing the France team, and I think that the French are too,' President Emmanuel Macron said.

entries.title: World Cup: For Lionel Messi and Argentina, now is all
entries.description: The script says Messi will be the conductor of football's great show and lift the trophy at the end of it. Will he?

entries.title: How Argentina fans brought a bit of Buenos Aires to ‘Barwargento’
entries.description: Barahat Al Janoub was renamed 'Barwargento' by Argentinian supporters who have brought a touch of their home to Qatar.

entries.title: Messi calligraphy sketches a big hit among Qatar World Cup fans
entries.description: Arabic calligraphy artist Khaled Almesawy says the World Cup has been great for his art business and for Qatar.

entries.title: Election deadlock in Fiji after all votes counted: Vote monitor
entries.description: Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama and political rival Sitiveni Rabuka are projected to win 26 seats each in parliament.

entries.title: North Korea fires ballistic missiles towards sea off east coast
entries.description: Launch comes three days after North Korea said it tested a 'high-thrust solid-fuel motor' engine for ballistic missiles.

entries.title: Freak wave kills three swimmers, injures 17 at South Africa beach
entries.description: Official says at least 17 people were hospitalised and in critical condition following a huge wave at Durban beach.

entries.title: Grenade launcher gifted by Ukraine wounds Polish police chief
entries.description: Polish police chief says the explosion that wounded him last week was caused by grenade launcher – a gift from Ukraine.

entries.title: World Cup 2022 closing ceremony set to be ‘A Night To Remember’
entries.description: Almost 90,000 are expected to attend Sunday’s closing ceremony at Lusail Stadium followed by the France-Argentina match.

entries.title: Bangladeshis, Argentina’s biggest fans, gear up for final
entries.description: Millions in the South Asian country support Argentina, which will take on France in Sunday's championship game in Qatar.
